page.title: 14Trade
page.content: The farmers sell their beasts and sheep at the cattle market in Castle Douglas, 20 km away. This market is held every week where cattle and sheep are sold to the local butchers. Special days are set aside for the sale of various breeds for the farmers to restock, or sell their surplus breeding stock. At these sales, breeders meet from far and wide - often as far as Australia and New Zealand and Europe where specialised breeds such as belties are bought to be exported as breeding stock. Many of the Galloway cattle breed around Borgue find their way to foreign ports.
